circumstances: The twin engine airplane departed Tampa Airport in the morning for a local pleasure flight. On final approach to Tampa Airport, the pilot failed to extend the landing gear. Upon landing, the engine's propeller struck the runway surface. The pilot initiated a go-around but unable to maintain altitude, the aircraft lost height and crashed into Tampa Bay. All six occupants were rescued with minor injuries and the aircraft was lost.
probable_cause:
Wheels-up landing and controlled collision with water during go-around manoeuvre. The following contributing factors were reported:
- The pilot failed to extend landing gear on approach, 
- Un maintain altitude during go-around due to prop damages.
